required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Intra-arterial Prostaglandin Therapy in Non-occlusive Mesenteric Ischemia
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of an Intra-arterial Prostaglandin Therapy in Non-occlusive Mesenteric Ischemia (NOMI)

brief_summary.textblock:
Minimal invasive intra-arterial prostaglandin therapy is currently being offered as an established and safe treatment approach for Non-occlusive mesenteric ischemia (NOMI). So far, there are no data that prospective evaluate clinical response parameters of this method and corresponding criteria for response.
The investigators are therefore planning a prospective observational study on NOMI patients with the aim to collect
1. routine clinical data,
2. data from advanced angigraphic imaging and
3. data from blood biomarkers of intestinal ischemia before/at implementation of intra-arterial vasodilatory therapy.
From these three data packages, the investigators hope to subsequentially derive criteria to better predict response to therapy.

secondary_outcome.measure: Concentration of Serum Lactate (KEY Secondary Outcome)
Change of norepinephrine dose in microgram/kg/min from baseline at 24 hours
simplified NOMI score, range 0-7 points with higher scores indicating more severe NOMI
secondary_outcome.description: angiographic characteristics of vasodilation following Initial Prostaglandin bolus

secondary_outcome.measure: peak density (PD) as measured by 2D perfusion angiography
secondary_outcome.description: angiographic characteristics of vasodilation following Initial Prostaglandin bolus

secondary_outcome.measure: area under the curve (AUC) as measured by 2D perfusion angiography
secondary_outcome.description: angiographic characteristics of vasodilation following Initial Prostaglandin bolus

secondary_outcome.measure: time to peak (TTP) as measured by 2D perfusion angiography
secondary_outcome.description: angiographic characteristics of vasodilation following Initial Prostaglandin bolus

secondary_outcome.measure: intestinal fatty acid-binding protein (I-FABP), smooth muscle protein of 22kDa (SM22) liver fatty acid-binding protein (L-FABP)
secondary_outcome.description: markers of ischemic intestinal barrier dysfunction

arm_group.description: Minimal invasive Cannulation of the Superior Mesenteric Artery (SMA) and subsequent intra-arterial application of prostaglandin E1 (Initial Bolus 20ug, followed by continuous Infusion of 60-80ug/24hr for 24-72hrs)

intervention.description: Minimal invasive Cannulation of the Superior Mesenteric Artery (SMA) and subsequent intra-arterial application of prostaglandin E1 (Initial Bolus 20ug, followed by continuous Infusion of 60-80ug/24hr for 24-72hrs)

study_pop.textblock: Patients admitted to the ICU with persistent shock, intestinal failure as well as new onset and progressive organ failure with a CT and angiography based diagnosis of Non-occlusive mesenteric ischemia (NOMI)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- persistent shock: Norepinephrine dose > 0.2ug/kg/min over > 48hrs
and
- intestinal failure: paralytic ileus > 24hrs despite neostigmine therapy or
- new onset progressive organ failure (2 out of six criteria): Norepinephrine dose increase, rise in serum lactate, decrease in Horowitz index, new renal replacement therapy, rise in bilirubin, rise in INR, or all of the following: rise in ALT, AST, CK and LDH
Exclusion Criteria:
- patients < 18 years old
- pregnancy
